title: Monet Survived the Heart Stabbing
theory: Many fans theorize that Monet survived the heart stabbing by Caesar Clown. The theory suggests that Caesar only lightly grazed or pushed Monet's heart rather than fully stabbing it, causing her to cough up blood and pass out but not die. Building C, where Monet was located, was confirmed by Oda to be completely fine and protected from the Shinokuni gas, giving her time to recover. Additionally, snow is shown falling again in Chapter 696, potentially indicating Monet's Devil Fruit powers are still active (snow stopped falling after the stabbing in Chapter 695). Some fans point to snow rabbits appearing in ocean waves in Chapter 700 as further hints of her survival.
author: One Piece Fan Community
source: Multiple sources including One Piece Wiki Forums, 12Dimension Blog, MangaHelpers
evidenceFor: Building C was confirmed safe from destruction
Visual ambiguity in the stabbing scene
Oda's tendency to keep characters alive
No explicit confirmation of death shown on-screen
evidenceAgainst: No subsequent appearances in the story
Blood shown coming from Monet's mouth
Narrative purpose served by her death
Lack of follow-up in later arcs

title: Monet Will Join the Straw Hats
theory: A subset of the Monet survival theory suggests that if she survived, she could potentially join the Straw Hat Pirates as a crewmate. Proponents argue that her loyalty to Doflamingo could be broken after his eventual defeat, and her snow powers would be useful for the crew. The theory gained traction after the Punk Hazard arc but has largely been dismissed by the community due to lack of evidence and her clear antagonistic role.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidenceAgainst: Attempted to kill the Straw Hats

title: Law's Heart Switch Was Planned from the Beginning
theory: Fans theorize that Trafalgar Law planned the heart switch between Smoker and Monet from the very beginning of his alliance with the Straw Hats, knowing that Caesar would eventually try to use the hearts as weapons. This demonstrates Law's strategic genius and his ability to manipulate situations several steps ahead. The theory suggests Law anticipated Doflamingo's ruthlessness and prepared accordingly.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidenceAgainst: No explicit confirmation in the story
Could have been opportunistic rather than planned
Law's surprised reactions in other scenes suggest improvisation

title: Doflamingo Knew Monet and Vergo Would Die
theory: This theory proposes that Doflamingo anticipated and accepted the deaths of Monet and Vergo as necessary sacrifices for his larger plans. His farewells to both subordinates in Episode 619 suggest he knew they wouldn't survive, yet he ordered the island's destruction anyway. This demonstrates both his ruthlessness and his strategic willingness to sacrifice even his most loyal followers to protect his secrets and business with Kaido.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidenceFor: His apology to Vergo for 'what is to come'
Ordering the self-destruct despite their presence
Need to eliminate evidence of SAD production
evidenceAgainst: Genuine emotion shown in the farewells
